alert.note: Alert for Cotton (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 23 at 8:00PM CDT until March 23 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Cotton County in southwestern Oklahoma... Extreme Northwestern Clay County in northern Texas... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 800 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles west of Burkburnett, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Walters, Randlett, Devol, Taylor and Charlie. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
